query: Where did Bilbo Baggins live?
ground_truth_answer: Bilbo Baggins lived in a hobbit-hole in the ground.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: In a hole in the ground there lived a hobbit.

query: What did the door of Bilbo's hobbit-hole look like?
ground_truth_answer: The hobbit-hole had a perfectly round door, similar to a porthole, that was painted green and had a shiny yellow brass knob in the very middle.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: It had a perfectly round door like a porthole, painted green, with a shiny yellow brass knob in the exact middle.

query: What are the physical characteristics of hobbits compared to humans and dwarves?
ground_truth_answer: Hobbits are small people, about half the height of humans and smaller than dwarves. Unlike dwarves, hobbits do not have beards.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: They are (or were) a little people, about half our height, and smaller than the bearded Dwarves.
Hobbits have no beards.

query: what was the meaning of the mark Gandalf put on Bilbo's door?
ground_truth_answer: The mark Gandalf put on Bilbo's door was a sign used in the trade that meant: "Burglar wants a good job, plenty of Excitement and reasonable Reward."

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: And I assure you there is a mark on this door — the usual one in the trade, or used to be. Burglar wants a good job, plenty of Excitement and reasonable Reward, that's how it is usually read.
After a while he stepped up, and with the spike on his staff scratched a queer sign on the hobbit's beautiful green front-door.

query: what were the names of the three trolls Bilbo encountered?
ground_truth_answer: The three trolls Bilbo encountered were named William, Bert, and Tom.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: “Mutton yesterday, mutton today, and blimey, if it don't look like mutton again tomorrer,” said one of the trolls.

“What the 'ell William was a-thinkin' of to bring us into these parts at all, beats me — and the drink runnin' short, what's more,” he said jogging the elbow of William, who was taking a pull at his jug.
Bert and Tom went off to the barrel.

query: How did Gandalf defeat the trolls?
ground_truth_answer: Gandalf defeated the trolls by using his voice to keep them arguing and bickering with each other until dawn. Trolls must be underground before dawn, otherwise they turn back into the mountain material they are made from and can never move again.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: It was the wizard's voice that had kept the trolls bickering and quarrelling, until the light came and made an end of them.
for trolls, as you probably know, must be underground before dawn, or they go back to the stuff of the mountains they are made of, and never move again.

query: What were the names and origins of the swords Gandalf and Thorin took from the trolls' lair?
ground_truth_answer: The swords were old swords of the High Elves of the West, made in Gondolin for the Goblin-wars. Thorin's sword was named Orcrist, the Goblin-cleaver, and Gandalf's was named Glamdring, the Foe-hammer, which was once worn by the king of Gondolin.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: They are old swords, very old swords of the High Elves of the West, my kin. They were made in Gondolin for the Goblin-wars.
This, Thorin, the runes name Orcrist, the Goblin-cleaver in the ancient tongue of Gondolin; it was a famous blade. This, Gandalf, was Glamdring, Foe-hammer that the king of Gondolin once wore.

query: What was the message written in moon-letters on Thorin's map?
ground_truth_answer: The message in moon-letters on the map, read by Elrond, was: “Stand by the grey stone when the thrush knocks, and the setting sun with the last light of Durin's Day will shine upon the key-hole.”

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: “ Stand by the grey stone when the thrush knocks. ” read Elrond, “and the setting sun with the last light of Durin's Day will shine upon the key-hole.”

query: How did the dwarves get captured by goblins in the Misty Mountains, and how did Gandalf escape?
ground_truth_answer: While sheltering from a storm in a cave, a crack opened in the back wall, and goblins emerged to grab Bilbo and the dwarves. Gandalf escaped because Bilbo's yell woke him up, and when the goblins came for him, he produced a blinding flash of light that killed several of them, allowing him to get away before the crack closed.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: A crack had opened at the back of the cave, and was already a wide passage.
and they were all grabbed and carried through the crack, before you could say tinder and flint.
when goblins came to grab him, there was a terrific flash like lightning in the cave, a smell like gunpowder, and several of them fell dead.

query: What did Bilbo find in the goblin tunnels after he was separated from the dwarves?
ground_truth_answer: While crawling along in the dark, Bilbo's hand met a tiny ring of cold metal lying on the floor of the tunnel.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: He guessed as well as he could, and crawled along for a good way, till suddenly his hand met what felt like a tiny ring of cold metal lying on the floor of the tunnel.

query: What was the last riddle Bilbo asked Gollum?
ground_truth_answer: The final question Bilbo asked Gollum, which Gollum treated as a riddle, was "What have I got in my pocket?".

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: “What have I got in my pocket?” he said aloud.

query: What was Gollum's "birthday-present" and what special ability did it have?
ground_truth_answer: Gollum's birthday present was a golden ring of power. If you slipped the ring on your finger, you would become invisible.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: He had a ring, a golden ring, a precious ring.
He wanted it because it was a ring of power, and if you slipped that ring on your finger, you were invisible;

query: How did the dwarves escape from the Elvenking's palace?
ground_truth_answer: Bilbo rescued the dwarves by packing them into empty barrels, which were then cast through a trapdoor into the underground stream. The barrels floated out of the water-gate and down the Forest River to Lake-town.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: When the barrels were empty the elves cast them through the trapdoors, opened the water-gate, and out the barrels floated on the stream, bobbing along, until they were carried by the current to a place far down the river
They soon found thirteen with room enough for a dwarf in each.

query: What is the Arkenstone of Thrain?
ground_truth_answer: The Arkenstone of Thrain, also known as the Heart of the Mountain, is a great white gem that the dwarves found long ago beneath the roots of the Mountain.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: But fairest of all was the great white gem, which the dwarves had found beneath the roots of the Mountain, the Heart of the Mountain, the Arkenstone of Thrain.

query: What was Smaug the dragon's weak spot?
ground_truth_answer: Smaug's weakness was a large, bare patch in the hollow of his left breast, which was not covered by the diamond armor on his underbelly.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: “Old fool! Why, there is a large patch in the hollow of his left breast as bare as a snail out of its shell!”

query: Who killed the dragon Smaug?
ground_truth_answer: Bard, a descendant of Girion, Lord of Dale, killed the dragon Smaug.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: He was a descendant in long line of Girion, Lord of Dale, whose wife and child had escaped down the Running River from the ruin long ago.
“I am Bard, of the line of Girion; I am the slayer of the dragon!”

query: How did Bard learn about Smaug's weak spot?
ground_truth_answer: An old thrush flew to Bard's shoulder and spoke to him. Because Bard was of the race of Dale, he could understand the bird's language. The thrush told him to look for the hollow of the dragon's left breast as he flew overhead.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: Suddenly out of the dark something fluttered to his shoulder. He started — but it was only an old thrush.
Unafraid it perched by his ear and it brought him news.
Marvelling he found he could understand its tongue, for he was of the race of Dale.
“The moon is rising. Look for the hollow of the left breast as he flies and turns above you!”

query: Who fought in the Battle of Five Armies?
ground_truth_answer: The Battle of Five Armies was fought between the Goblins and the Wild Wolves on one side, and the Elves, Men, and Dwarves on the other.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: Upon one side were the Goblins and the Wild Wolves, and upon the other were Elves and Men and Dwarves.

query: Which members of Thorin's company died in the Battle of Five Armies?
ground_truth_answer: Thorin Oakenshield, Fili, and Kili died as a result of the Battle of Five Armies. Fili and Kili died defending Thorin.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: There indeed lay Thorin Oakenshield, wounded with many wounds, and his rent armour and notched axe were cast upon the floor.
Of the twelve companions of Thorin, ten remained. Fili and Kili had fallen defending him with shield and body, for he was their mother's elder brother.

query: What was happening at Bilbo's home when he returned from his journey?
ground_truth_answer: When Bilbo returned to his hobbit-hole, he found his belongings were being sold at an auction because he had been "Presumed Dead."

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: He had arrived back in the middle of an auction!
In short Bilbo was “Presumed Dead”, and not everybody that said so was sorry to find the presumption wrong.

query: How did the Wood-elves differ from the High Elves of the West?
ground_truth_answer: The Wood-elves were considered more dangerous and less wise than the High Elves. This is because most Wood-elves were descended from tribes that never went to Faerie in the West, where the High Elves lived for ages, growing fairer, wiser, and more learned while inventing their magic and crafts. The Wood-elves, in contrast, remained in the mortal world, wandering the great forests.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: They differed from the High Elves of the West, and were more dangerous and less wise.
For most of them (together with their scattered relations in the hills and mountains) were descended from the ancient tribes that never went to Faerie in the West.

There the Fight-elves and the Deep-elves and the Sea- elves went and lived for ages, and grew fairer and wiser and more learned, and invented their magic and their cunning craft in the making of beautiful and marvellous things, before some came back into the Wide World.
In the Wide World the Wood-elves lingered in the twilight of our Sun and Moon, but loved best the stars;
and they wandered in the great forests that grew tall in lands that are now lost.

query: Who is Beorn, what does he eat, and what are his animals like?
ground_truth_answer: Beorn is a very strong skin-changer who can appear as either a huge black bear or a great, strong man with black hair. He lives mostly on cream and honey from the hives of great, fierce bees he keeps and does not hunt or eat wild animals. His cattle and horses are described as nearly as marvelous as he is; they are able to work for him and talk to him.

relevant_chunks.text_snippet: If you must know more, his name is Beorn. He is very strong, and he is a skin-changer.”
He changes his skin: sometimes he is a huge black bear, sometimes he is a great strong black-haired man with huge arms and a great beard.
He keeps hives and hives of great fierce bees, and lives most on cream and honey.
neither does he hunt or eat wild animals.
and as a man he keeps cattle and horses which are nearly as marvellous as himself.
They work for him and talk to him.
